ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: one hour per week
1 hour
0 except for the time there were 3 assignments- 3 hours for assignments 1&2- assignment 3 was a group project and took 5-6 hours.Other than that just came to class and lounged out.Very informal

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Lections were very detailed with good explanation. This courses were very useful for me.

The course was well designed and gave a broad overview of randomized clinical trials. I found the topics discussed in the class very interesting and engaging. It was a great overview of simple size calculations, power analysis, history and designs of clinical trials. I would recommend the course to students, PIs, research personnel interested in conducting randomized clinical trials.

A lot of the material was review from regulatory affairs and clinical trials. It would have been interesting to find out more about clinical trials from multiple perspectives - not just how to set up a trial, but different considerations from the pharmaceutical industry as well.
This is such a great class! I learned so much from Maria.

This is a good course which covers the material implied by the title of the course. However, the vast majority of the course is spent listening to lectures. A format that is more engaging, perhaps with discussion of landmark trials during class in combination with lecture, would have helped my enjoyment.

Easy course.Lightest one I ever had at YSPHIt is suppose to be that way. That is what i took out of it.The slides for the course are great and lots of meaningful information.Most of the information in the class is already known. It was a good review.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is great. No stress at all. She gave me all extra information, that I asked her.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Dr. Ciarleglio is very approachable, always ready to assist students with their questions. She is very well organized and knowledgeable. I enjoyed her as my instructor.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  -Well organized and timely.-Speaks clearly. Explains clearly.-Receptive to answering questions.-Uses examples from her professional experience.-Willing to answer emails in a timely manner.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is very understanding and tailors the coursework to the types of students taking the class. The class would have been more engaging if it was more interactive; instead of all lecture material, we could have had more class discussion about current topics in clinical trials.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is a great professor! She is very excited to teach, which really shows during her lectures. Her liveliness really made learning fun, and although some of the material was tough, she would always try her best to introduce difficult subjects. She would thoroughly answer any questions.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is an excellent instructor who is responsive to student feedback and is wonderful to learn from.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria was very helpful and knowledgeable. She did a great job teaching the class.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Great.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I am satisfied. Yes I would recommend it to another student.

It was a great overview of simple size calculations, power analysis, history and designs of clinical trials. I would recommend the course to all students, PIs, research personnel who are interested in conducting randomized clinical trials.
I would definitely recommend this class to another student, especially for students who are interested in the field of medicine.
Lighter workload than other classes, good content. I will plan to keep Maria's slides as references for the future.

Easy course.Lightest one I ever had at YSPHIt is suppose to be that way. That is what i took out of it.The slides for the course are great and lots of meaningful information.Most of the information in the class is already known. It was a good review.
